step_by_step.explanation: A chemical bond is a force that holds atoms together in a compound.

problems.final_answer: Chemical bond: force holding atoms together in a compound.

step_by_step.explanation: An ionic bond is formed when one atom transfers electrons to another, resulting in positive and negative ions that attract each other.

problems.final_answer: Ionic bond: electron transfer forming oppositely charged ions.

problems.problem: Give an example of an ionic compound.

step_by_step.explanation: Sodium chloride (NaCl) is formed from Na⁺ and Cl⁻ ions.

problems.problem: Explain the properties of ionic compounds.

step_by_step.explanation: Ionic compounds have high melting/boiling points, conduct electricity when molten or dissolved in water, and are usually crystalline solids.

problems.final_answer: High melting/boiling points, conduct electricity when molten/aqueous, crystalline solids.

step_by_step.explanation: A metallic bond is the attraction between positive metal ions and the sea of delocalized electrons surrounding them.

problems.final_answer: Metallic bond: positive ions held by delocalized electrons.

problems.problem: List properties of metals due to metallic bonding.

step_by_step.explanation: Good electrical and thermal conductivity, malleability, ductility, and shiny appearance.

problems.problem: Compare ionic and metallic bonding in terms of electron movement.

step_by_step.explanation: Electrons are transferred from one atom to another.
Electrons are delocalized and free to move throughout the metal lattice.

problems.final_answer: Ionic: electron transfer; Metallic: delocalized electrons move freely.

problems.problem: Explain why ionic compounds conduct electricity only when molten or in solution.

step_by_step.explanation: In solid form, ions are fixed in the lattice. Molten or aqueous ions are free to move, allowing electric current to flow.

problems.final_answer: Ions fixed in solid; free in molten/aqueous → conduct electricity.

problems.problem: Explain why metals are malleable and ductile.

step_by_step.explanation: Delocalized electrons allow metal ions to slide past each other without breaking the metallic bond.

problems.final_answer: Delocalized electrons let ions slide → metals malleable/ductile.

problems.problem: Write the formula for magnesium chloride and identify the ions involved.

step_by_step.explanation: Magnesium has 2⁺ charge (Mg²⁺), chloride has 1⁻ charge (Cl⁻). Two chlorides balance one magnesium: MgCl₂

problems.final_answer: Formula: MgCl₂; ions: Mg²⁺ and Cl⁻.
